text: Psalm 88
A Prayer for Help in Despair
A song. A psalm of the sons of Korah.
For the \add music\add* director; according to Mahalath Leannoth.
A maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.\f + \fr Ps 88 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
O Yahweh, God of my salvation,
I cry out by day \add and\add* through the night before you.
Let my prayer come before you;
incline your ear to my cry.
For my soul is full with troubles,
and my life approaches Sheol.
I am reckoned with \add those\add* descending to \add the\add* pit.
I am like a man\f + \fr 88:4 \ft The Hebrew suggests a strong, vigorous man \f* without strength,\f + \fr 88:4 \ft Or “without help” \f*
set free\f + \fr 88:5 \ft Or “forsaken” \f* among the dead,
like \add the\add* slain lying in \add the\add* grave,
whom you no longer remember,
even those cut off from your hand.
You have set me in \add the\add* pit below,
in dark places, in \add the\add* depths.
Your wrath presses upon me,
and you afflict \add me with\add* all your waves. \qs Selah\qs*
You have removed my acquaintances far from me.
You have made me detestable\f + \fr 88:8 \ft Hebrew “an abomination” \f* to them.
\add I am\add* confined and cannot go out.
My eye languishes from misery.
I call on you, O Yahweh, every day;
I spread out my hands\f + \fr 88:9 \ft Hebrew “palms” \f* to you.
Do you work wonders\f + \fr 88:10 \ft Hebrew “wonder” \f* for the dead?

Or do \add the\add* departed spirits\f + \fr 88:10 \ft Hebrew \fqa rephaim \ft , sometimes translated “shades”; the weakened state of those who have died \f* rise up \add to\add* praise you? \qs Selah\qs*
Is your loyal love told in the grave,
\add or\add* your faithfulness in the underworld?\f + \fr 88:11 \ft Hebrew \fqa abaddon \ft , the place of destruction \f*
Are your wonders\f + \fr 88:12 \ft Hebrew “wonder” \f* known in the darkness,
\add or\add* your righteousness\f + \fr 88:12 \ft Or “deed of justice” \f* in \add the\add* land of forgetfulness?
But as for me, I cry for help to you, O Yahweh,
and in the morning my prayer comes before you.
Why do you reject my soul, O Yahweh?
\add Why\add* do you hide your face from me?
I \add am\add* afflicted and perishing from \add my\add* youth.
I bear your terrors. I am distraught.\f + \fr 88:15 \ft Hebrew meaning uncertain \f*
Your burning anger has passed over me;
your sudden fears have destroyed me.
They surround me like water all the day;
they circle about me altogether.
You have removed loved one and friend far from me,
my acquaintances \add far from my\add* darkness.
